Class NewEngine

java.lang.Object
dev.royalcore.api.engine.NewEngine
@Experimental public class NewEngine extends Object
New engine responsible for managing battle royale sessions and state.

  • Method Details

    • validateScheduleForScenario

      public Result validateScheduleForScenario(Scenario scenario)
      Validates all schedules registered for the given Scenario and binds them to the Bukkit scheduler to be executed when the scenario starts.

      Each registered SchedulerConsumer.ScheduleWindow is interpreted as:

      • Empty start and stop: run immediately on scenario start.
      • Present start, empty stop: run once after the given delay.
      • Present start and stop: run repeatedly with the given initial delay and period.
      Any other combination is treated as invalid.
      Parameters:
      scenario - the scenario whose registered schedules are validated and scheduled
      Returns:
      a Result.Ok if all schedules are valid and bound, or a Result.Err if an invalid schedule window is encountered

    • checkDupe

      public <T> Result checkDupe(List<T> objects, Consumer<List<T>> action)
      Checks a list for duplicate elements using their Object.equals(Object) implementation.

      When at least one duplicate is present, the provided action is invoked with the original list (so the caller can inspect or handle duplicates as desired).

      Type Parameters:
      T - the element type contained in the list being checked
      Parameters:
      objects - the list to inspect for duplicates
      action - the action to execute when duplicates are detected, receiving the original list
      Returns:
      a Result.Ok if no duplicates are found, or a Result.Err if at least one duplicate exists

    • checkCommandLiteralDupes

      public <C> Result checkCommandLiteralDupes(List<C> commands, Function<C,String> firstLiteralExtractor, Consumer<List<C>> onDupes)
      Checks for commands that share the same first literal (name) and reports duplicates.

      The first literal is extracted for each command via firstLiteralExtractor, and any literal value that appears more than once is treated as a duplicate. All commands that participate in such duplicates are passed to onDupes.

      Type Parameters:
      C - the command type contained in the list
      Parameters:
      commands - the list of command objects to inspect
      firstLiteralExtractor - a function that extracts the first literal (for example, the primary label) from a command instance
      onDupes - a consumer invoked with the list of commands that have duplicate literals
      Returns:
      a Result.Ok if no duplicate literals are found, or a Result.Err if any duplicate first literals are detected

    • forEachDupe

      public <T> Result forEachDupe(List<T> objects, Consumer<T> action)
      Executes an action once for each distinct duplicate element in the given list.

      Elements are compared using Object.equals(Object). For every value that appears more than once, action is invoked exactly once with that value.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the element type contained in the list
      Parameters:
      objects - the list to inspect for duplicate values
      action - the action to run for each distinct duplicate element found
      Returns:
      a Result.Ok if no duplicates are found, or a Result.Err describing the duplicates that were detected
